title: Facebook usage frequency in the United States 2018 , by ethnicity
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Frequencys for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, White had the highest Share of respondents in Frequency At least once a day and Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
In Frequency At least once a day, Hispanic had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Frequency Don't know/No opinion out of all 7 Frequencys.
There is a gap of 55.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Hispanic in Frequency At least once a day and Don't know/No opinion.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 7 different Frequencys on X-axis for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 4 groups, White had the highest Share of respondents in Frequency At least once a day and Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Frequencys for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, White had the highest Share of respondents in Frequency At least once a day and Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
In Frequency At least once a day, Hispanic had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Frequency Don't know/No opinion out of all 7 Frequencys.
There is a gap of 55.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Hispanic in Frequency At least once a day and Don't know/No opinion.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 7 different Frequencys on X-axis for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Frequency At least once a day, White had the highest Share of respondents 64.0 among the 4 groups and in Don't know/No opinion, Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents 1.0.
In Frequency At least once a day, Hispanic had the highest Share of respondents among all 7 Frequencys and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
There is a gap of 55.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Hispanic in Frequency At least once a day and Don't know/No opinion.
Among all 4 groups, White had the gap of 62.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents observed in Frequency At least once a day and Don't know/No opinion respectively.

White had the maximum Share of respondents out of all 4 groups in Frequency At least once a day followed by White in At least once a day, and the minimum Share of respondents is found for Hispanic in Don't know/No opinion.

On average, the Frequency At least once a day had the highest Share of respondents for all 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other. Whereas Don't know/No opinion had the lowest average Share of respondents.
